caption: LOVED IT!! It's expensive however well worth it. Great food, service, atmosphere! We celebrated a bday. I would Uber there if you can, parking isn't the best.
Great ambience
LOVED THIS PLACE! Performances were amazing, so were the drinks.
Quite possibly the best new restaurant in Baltimore regardless of price point

Very cool experience with amazing food - more than a steak house, which are basically all the same, this is unique. The service was impeccable and familial. Starters, entrees, sides, desert, all stunning. We started at the bar with an array of cocktails then had dinner and a show, which might seem odd but not at all. It was quite seamless and amazing. We had a table in front of the stage but really any seat is good and I’d probably recommend a booth. In a sea of sameness Monarque is an unique and individual experience. Plus, the Elk Room is right there and you can stroll the harbor within a block before or after dinner. We’ve tried most of the Atlas Group restaurants and highly recommend any of them.

I’m only giving this place 2 stars because I was seated in a timely manner, and my food was brought out in a decent amount of time. I was not satisfied with my experience at all. I decided to come here to celebrate my birthday, and was genuinely disappointed. The customer service needs some work. I was seated at the bar after the hostess informed me that she did not have any tables available. The bartender asked me if I would be dining and I said yes, he gave a menu and walked away allowing time for me to decide what I wanted to order. Not once did he come back over, and ask if I was ready to order. The entire time I had to ask for everything. NOT ONCE was I asked if I needed anything, or how was my order. The steak was ok, I’ve had better. The cocktails was ok, I’ve had better. The burlesque show was just ok. This is not the type of restaurant you go to,to celebrate a birthday. Everything was just ok, not worthy of $100 plus bill. I also felt I may have been pre-judged based off of the way I look. This will be my first, and last time coming here. I could have gone to Ruth’s Chris, The Prime Rib, or Capital Grille  and would have received better service.

Went for drinks and the show.  Had a difficult time getting in.  We were told COVID restrictions limited number of people.  We waited a little while and were allowed to replace another party leaving the bar.  I think this was because we did not have dinner there.  We saw other people latter filling-up the place, but all were having dinner.  Good cocktails but fairly pricy.  Not more than you would pay at any other premium bar in Harbor East though.  Absinthe was very good and strong, great for the French atmosphere.  That atmosphere was excellent, definitely recommend going just for that.  We also had a chocolate mousse that was outstanding.  The show was more entertainment than show, good for Baltimore, but don't expect Vegas.
Food was absolutely amazing. Never had a short rib so tender in my life. Staff is super friendly. Alan is absolutely amazing. Extremely knowledgeable and the sweetest

I feel like this place is trying too hard to be so many different things: a club +bar, a high end restaurant, and live entertainment center. We went for a romantic steak dinner, but the loud music made it hard to converse and we didn't have a great view of the sporadic entertainment. This place primarily serves steaks, and the prices are a la cart (so you pay for the sides seperately). Based on the atmosphere, this is more a place to get drinks, maybe appetizers instead of a full course meal. The duck confit was delicious, but I would not go there for steaks. We got filet mignon and it was oversalted and overpriced.

Went there for our anniversary last night.  The ambience was beautiful.  The environment felt safe and was in a special area.  The food and drinks were excellent.  I don’t usually post reviews but this one deserves it.  Thank you to servers, kitchen staff and chef for a lovely and sorely missed time out.
I loved this place, will be back for the entertainment. The food and drinks were superb
(Translated by Google) Excellent good price of meals  (Original) Excelente buen precio de las comidas
Great food
Food was good, entertainment was amazing, and service was wonderful. I will definitely be back.
Great

This place is unreal when you look at the outside and then walk inside its like going back in time into a speak easy. But its so fancy and elegant I wish I could go here all the time. And the steak was absolutely excellent while watching the show I didn't want to ever leave.

We made reservations to celebrate our wedding anniversary and my husband's birthday.  Monarque went above and beyond our expectations. The restaurant setup was very COVID-19 friendly and was very clean.  The decor definitely went with the restaurant theme. Our server Emily was amazing, she was very knowledgeable about every item on the menu and all of her suggestions didn't disappoint.  We can't wait to go back during brunch or a weekday to experience the band and the burlesque dancers
A top spot for Steaks. got there near six, it wasn't packed at all. the service was very welcoming and observant.
Stunning restaurant. Ambiance is lovely like being in Moulin Rouge.
Amazing food and amazing experience
Baltimore need a restaurant with a great chef and shows.

The moment we entered the restaurant, we were in awe! The hostess warmly greeted us and escorted us to an intimate table right at the stage. The decor and atmosphere are amazing. Our waiter, Juquon, was the best ever. He was extremely knowledgeable on all aspects of the menu and provided excellent drink and food recommendations. The truffle bread, turbot, and rivers were extremely flavorful and delicious. And the entertainment was the icing on the cake! My birthday dinner was amazing and I can't wait to return.

Our recent experience at Monarque by far exceeded our expectations and was beyond superior. The beautiful restaurant is perfect for that special occasion or simply a get away to Paris vibe. With the holidays coming up it will be the top notch spot for a Christmas/holiday dinner. The atmosphere, food, cocktails, and wine were amazing and the staff from the chefs, bartenders and servers are meticulous in details and provided a 10 star experience. The entrance has a beautiful display of the steaks and seafood, and the wine room was breathtaking. For cocktails I recommend the La Vie en Rose which was beautifully crafted and the Bison Chaton was tasty as well. All of the appetizers were beyond satisfying, it was hard to choose a favorite. For my main meal, I got the Rib Cap with the potatoes au gratin. The Rib Cap was tender, melted like butter, made exactly to order and the au gratin was a cheesy potato lovers dream. As far as covid concerns ( I noticed someone else's comment above and wanted to set the record straight from personal experience), they were extremely safe and followed all safety procedures, tables spaced out and staff wore masks, gloves and sanitized.  We felt totally safe and comfortable and would highly recommend anyone to go and enjoy this exquisite restaurant. Well done, Monarque for exceeding our experience beyond what we could imagine, we look forward to our next night out soon!

From the moment you enter, Monarque truly takes you back to France! Our cocktails, entrees and service were exceptional throughout the evening.  I thoroughly enjoyed the Rib Cap and would order it again.  Looking forward to another visit for the entertainment, hospitality, and cuisine. My wife and I truly thank you for the wonderful evening!

I'm in love with the Monarque! The multi-sensory culinary voyage transferred me back in time while enjoying the best talent I have seen in Baltimore so far. While enjoying the duck confit and truffled roasted chicken my taste buds lead me to believe I was back in France. This is exactly what I needed after a long year of being unable to travel. Looking forward to the next trip!

I'm in love with the Monarque! The multi-sensory culinary voyage transferred me back in time while enjoying the best talent I have seen in Baltimore so far. While enjoying the duck confit and truffled roasted chicken my taste buds lead me to believe I was back in France. This is exactly what I needed after a long year of being unable to travel. Looking forward to the next trip!

We have had a great experience here (3x already!).  The Atlas group and Patrick Sutton design delivered another stellar product.  In terms of the food, I would rate it a 10.  I ordered the Turbot, which is probably the best fish I have ever had and my wife ordered the tomahawk ribeye (she's eating for 2).  The craft cocktails were equally delicious.   Treat yourself!

This was the best steak Baltimore has seen in a very long time!  I do enjoy the steak at Capital Grille, but this place has the total package with craft cocktails, rare cuts and entertainment.  I got the rib cab and my wife got the strip, both were a 10.  We used uber so I cannot speak for the valet service, but all around - a hit!

Not Covid Safe AT ALL. Tables were spaced no more than 3 feet apart, the bar was completely full, and almost NO ONE was wearing masks in the restaurant (Easily 50+ people in there). I’m pretty upset about it. All you have to do is google “Atlas Group Baltimore” to find out more about how this company puts profit over people. Cocktails also bland and overpriced.
